I've been trying to build a vehicle to move and taxi around some of my jets in the KSC, but I can't get them to work... The idea is a truck that traps the front landing wheel of the aircraft to drag it around, but I can't figure out how can it be done (I have tried landing legs but it seems they won't do the trick).

Any ideas or suggestions?
Maybe solar panels, Probley will break, but give it a try

Maybe instead of that, try putting a docking port on the bottom or near the cockpit and one on the truck at the same angle and height so that they can dock. I've seen a few trucks on the forums that use this.

Maybe solar panels, Probley will break, but give it a try

They break indeed hahaha

Maybe instead of that, try putting a docking port on the bottom or near the cockpit and one on the truck at the same angle and height so that they can dock. I've seen a few trucks on the forums that use this.

That was one of the solutions I thought... But the docking ports don't allow much torsion, so it wouldn't make sharp turns...
Build something that has a hook made of the small girders to grab the front landing gear, and use the small wheels.
Ok, I just realised the problem is that the collision mesh of the landing gear is just the wheel and the casing, but not wat's in between, so if you try grabbing the "leg" it just won't work...

I use a docking port on the top of the aircraft, and a vehicle tugs it along via a boom equipped with a docking port. True, turning pays a price, but I have noticed that by raising the front landing gear and playing with which wheels have steering control enabled, one can get a reasonable taxi.
If you're totally not against mods maybe you can use KAS, and some quantum struts, those things always work for towing and dragging stuff behind
again with the mods you could use dammed robotics and put the rotating servo under a docking port so it could freely swing, just a thought

If you're totally not against mods maybe you can use KAS, and some quantum struts, those things always work for towing and dragging stuff behind

I'm not totally against mods, but I prefer the stock way xD

Retract some of the landing gear on the plane, preferably as much of the front gear as possible without the plane collapsing. When you dock you can then invert steering on a few rover wheels of the tug so that they all turn the same direction. You effectively end up with a front wheel drive front wheel steering car, just a very big one. Reasonably effective.

Alternative I have used is to actually stick rover wheels on the plane, if you have them so that they are slightly higher than the landing gear wheels then they are protected from bursting under landing, then you can retract the rear landing gear (or front if you went that way) to lower the rover wheels into contact with the ground. I tend to only do one end of the craft.

you might have too put some other part under there for the legs to grab, like a tail hook sortof thing

if i was doing it though id just use kas cables and plugs, a lot easier
